FacilityName: Maryland & Virginia Milk Producers-Farm Supply War
ParentCompanyName: Maryland & Virginia Milk Producers Coop Assn, Inc.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Maryland & Virginia Milk Producers, Farm Supply Warehouse's primary business is distribution of agricultural chemicals and farm supplies.  The facility is located at 7432 Grove Rd., Frederick, MD 21704.  The SIC code for the operation is 5191 the NAICS code is 424910.  The facility has approximately 10 full time employees.  The facility operates 8 hours/day, 5 days/week, 52 weeks/year.



The facility operates a warehouse that handles and stores formaldehyde 37% solution in drums and tote tanks.  40 CFR 68.130 lists formaldehyde as a hazardous chemical subject to RMP regulation with a threshold quantity of 15,000 pounds.  The maximum inventory could exceed 15,000 pounds. 



The facility has evaluated and reported one worst case scenario and has evaluated alternate scenarios and reported one which will result in an offsite impact that is more likely to occur than the worst case scenario.



The facility has never experienced a significant release incident.  Formaldehyde is received by truck in 15-gallon, 55-gallon and 300-gallon containers.  The containers are only stored at the facility.  No liquid transfer or mixing occurs.



The facility has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program (PSM) in accordance with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standard, 29 CFR 1910.119.  The facility's PSM program includes provisions for process hazard analyses, management of change, pre-start up safety reviews, safe work practices, inspections, testing, maintenance, compliance audits, and contractor qualifications.  The PSM program is reviewed annually and updated as necessary.  All significant changes to the system are reviewed in accordance with the PSM / RMP management of change provisions in the facility's plan.



The warehouse is inspected daily during operating hours.  Container inventory is maintained daily.



The warehouse is designed and equipped with sensors, monitors, alarms and safety systems.  In the event an accident that

could result in a formaldehyde release or fire, these protective devices will alarm and activate the fire sprinkler system.



The facility has made arrangements with the local fire department and outside contractors to respond to emergencies involving formaldehyde.  The facility conducts periodic incident evacuation drills.  The facility has never experienced a formaldehyde release that resulted in employee, contractor or off-site injuries, or offsite evacuation or sheltering in place.  Facility personnel are trained in the company's Emergency Action Plan in the event an incident should occur.



The facility has complied with the requirements of section 302 and 303 of the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act (EPCRA) by notifying the State Emergency Response Commission (SERC), the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), and the Fire Department of the presence of formaldehyde at the site.  The facility files a Tier 2 Chemical Inventory each year with the SERC, LEPC and the Fire Department as required by sections 311 and 312 of EPCRA.  The facility's Emergency Action Plan includes procedures for notifying the proper agencies in the event of a reportable release of formaldehyde.  A release of 100 pounds or more must be reported to the National Response Center, the SERC, and LEPC, in accordance with section 304 of EPCRA.  The Fire Department will be provided with a copy of the facility's Emergency Action Plan upon request.
